DialogueNode.Name: none
DialogueNode.Text: I open my eyes. Everything seems unfamiliar.

DialogueNode.Name: Doctor
DialogueNode.Text: Oh, you’re up. You’re one lucky kid, you know.

DialogueNode.Name: none
DialogueNode.Text: I try to say something, but it comes out as an unintelligible mumble.

DialogueNode.Name: Doctor
DialogueNode.Text: You got brought here about 16 hours ago.

DialogueNode.Name: You
DialogueNode.Text: Sixteen?

DialogueNode.Name: Doctor
DialogueNode.Text: Yeah. Your car rolled off the highway. It’s almost a miracle that you’re only suffering from stress and no physical injuries.

DialogueNode.Name: You
DialogueNode.Text: What about my mom…?

DialogueNode.Name: Doctor
DialogueNode.Text: She’s… in critical condition.

DialogueNode.Name: none
DialogueNode.Text: I can’t believe what I’m hearing. How could I have let this happen?

DialogueNode.Name: You
DialogueNode.Text: Can I see her?

DialogueNode.Name: Doctor
DialogueNode.Text: Yes, but please wait a little while longer. I just want to make sure you’re okay first.

DialogueNode.Name: none
DialogueNode.Text: My body feels mostly fine, but my mind can’t get over the incident.

DialogueNode.Name: none
DialogueNode.Text: I look around for my bag and see it on a table nearby.

DialogueNode.Name: You
DialogueNode.Text: Excuse me, Mr. Doctor, can I have my bag?

DialogueNode.Name: Doctor
DialogueNode.Text: Sure.

DialogueNode.Name: none
DialogueNode.Text: He smiles with pity and hands me my things.

DialogueNode.Name: none
DialogueNode.Text: I quickly pull out my prism and look for new notifications, but don’t see any. I send a message to my more recent paraself.

DialogueNode.Name: You
DialogueNode.Text: Are you okay?

DialogueNode.Name: none
DialogueNode.Text: It takes a little while to get a response.

DialogueNode.Name: Paraself 2
DialogueNode.Text: Why would I not be? How about you?

DialogueNode.Name: none
DialogueNode.Text: I don’t get it. Why only me? Why was I the one to suffer?

DialogueNode.Name: none
DialogueNode.Text: One day later, I’m discharged from the hospital. In one of her rare moments of consciousness, my mom tells me to check on the house. I guess I’ll…

DialogueNode.Name: none
DialogueNode.Text: I’ve had enough of car rides for now.

DialogueNode.Name: none
DialogueNode.Text: While I walk, my mind wanders.

DialogueNode.Name: none
DialogueNode.Text: I can’t stop thinking about my mom.

DialogueNode.Name: none
DialogueNode.Text: Maybe I’m just cursed.

DialogueNode.Name: none
DialogueNode.Text: Maybe this is the price of using a prism.

DialogueNode.Name: none
DialogueNode.Text: I get home and drop onto the couch, mentally exhausted.

DialogueNode.Name: none
DialogueNode.Text: I pull out my phone and give Lyanna a call. She picks up.

DialogueNode.Name: Lyanna
DialogueNode.Text: Hey, [main].

DialogueNode.Name: You
DialogueNode.Text: Hey Lyanna, could you pick me up from the Tommery Hospital?

DialogueNode.Name: none
DialogueNode.Text: If you're reading this, I have made a mistake XD

DialogueNode.Name: Lyanna
DialogueNode.Text: Hospital? What happened?

DialogueNode.Name: You
DialogueNode.Text: My mom…

DialogueNode.Name: none
DialogueNode.Text: I can’t finish my sentence without visualizing her wounded body.

DialogueNode.Name: Lyanna
DialogueNode.Text: I’ll be there soon, [main].

DialogueNode.Name: none
DialogueNode.Text: About ten minutes later, Lyanna shows up.

DialogueNode.Name: You
DialogueNode.Text: You’re not legally allowed to take me home, are you?

DialogueNode.Name: Lyanna
DialogueNode.Text: Shhhhhhh, I’m trying not to make it obvious!!!

DialogueNode.Name: none
DialogueNode.Text: While Lyanna’s antics are quite childish, I appreciate her goodwill. I get into her car.

DialogueNode.Name: none
DialogueNode.Text: On the way back, Lyanna tries to make conversation a couple of times but can tell that I need to be alone. She drops me off after a silent ride.

DialogueNode.Name: Lyanna
DialogueNode.Text: Bye [main]! Call me if you need anything. It’ll be my excuse to get out of class.

DialogueNode.Name: none
DialogueNode.Text: I leave her and enter my house.

DialogueNode.Name: none
DialogueNode.Text: My phone rings out, and Sawyer doesn’t pick up.

DialogueNode.Name: none
DialogueNode.Text: Sawyer’s usually always online, but I cut them some slack. It’s seven in the morning after all.

DialogueNode.Name: none
DialogueNode.Text: I suppose I’ll have to pick a different way home.

DialogueNode.Name: none
DialogueNode.Text: Nothing takes my mind off of the condition of my mom. If there’s any way for me to make sure my mom lives, I’d do it in a heartbeat.

DialogueNode.Name: none
DialogueNode.Text: Is there anyone who can help me? I message my first paraself.

DialogueNode.Name: You
DialogueNode.Text: Hey, can you help me find a way to cure my mom?

DialogueNode.Name: Paraself 1
DialogueNode.Text: What happened?

DialogueNode.Name: You
DialogueNode.Text: She got hurt in a car crash, and the doctors don’t know how to stabilize her.

DialogueNode.Name: Paraself 1
DialogueNode.Text: I haven’t learned any medical knowledge since we split. Maybe you should reach out to some more doctors, and maybe a paraself can help you search.

DialogueNode.Name: none
DialogueNode.Text: I rush towards my mom’s room in search of her stash of prisms.

DialogueNode.Name: none
DialogueNode.Text: Her closet? I should have known.

DialogueNode.Name: none
DialogueNode.Text: I activate a prism.

DialogueNode.Name: none
DialogueNode.Text: What did I just do?

DialogueNode.Name: none
DialogueNode.Text: I activate another prism.

DialogueNode.Name: none
DialogueNode.Text: Did I just create a new suffering me?

DialogueNode.Name: none
DialogueNode.Text: I activate another prism.

DialogueNode.Name: none
DialogueNode.Text: HELP ME

DialogueNode.Name: none
DialogueNode.Text: I cry on the floor of my mom’s room. Is this reality? The image of eight versions of me all crying on the floor hurts to picture.

DialogueNode.Name: none
DialogueNode.Text: I’m tired. The doctors can wait. I hope my mom can.

DialogueNode.Name: none
DialogueNode.Text: I don’t know anymore.
